items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Wey, particularly around the Passfield area, as a result of heavy rainfall. 
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area checking defences. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 19/06/21, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Thame as a result of persistent heavy rainfall yesterday 18/06/21. Therefore, flooding of low-lying land, footpaths and roads is imminent, especially in the Thame area. Levels on the Chalgrove Brook are below the flood risk threshold.
Some further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours, but totals will be low. We expect river levels to continue rising through today 19/06/21.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area checking key areas at greatest flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and avoid contact with flood water. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 20/06/21, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen following the rainfall yesterday.  Light rainfall may affect the area today, however this is not expected to cause any flooding. Further rainfall is forecast tonight and over the next few days which may require further alerts to be issued.

We continue to monitor the situation closely and will reissue this alert if necessary.

items.message: As the forecast for today is relatively clear this alert is no longer in force. There may be heavy downpours overnight, these are likely to be localised. The weather continues to feature intense showers over the weekend. We are monitoring the forecast closely for Monday as it is possible that there may be heavy downpours on Monday 21/06/2021 and Tuesday 22/06/2021.

items.description: River Blackwater and The Cove Brook
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Blackwater and The Cove Brook as a result of heavy rainfall through today. 
Further rainfall is forecast over night and into tomorrow. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are operating weirs to reduce flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen and no further flooding is expected. Further light rainfall is forecast this evening. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Surface or standing water may remain. You should avoid walking, driving or cycling through floodwater.

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels remain high but continue to fall on the River Kennet following persistent heavy rainfall yesterday 18/06/21. Therefore, the risk of flooding is reducing. 
Some further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours, but totals will be low. River levels are falling, but remain sensitive to further rainfall and therefore still pose a flood risk.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area checking key areas at greatest flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings, and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 20/06/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The River Roach, Prittle Brook and Eastwood Brook
items.message: Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no further rainfall during the day today, Saturday 19th June 2021, with light rain overnight tonight and tomorrow, Sunday 20th June 2021. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Loddon as a result of heavy rainfall. 
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area checking defences. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 19/06/21, or as the situation changes.

Water levels in the Monks Brook from Chandlers Ford to Swaythling are now falling. We expect water levels to return to normal overnight. The weather remains largely dry on Saturday but more unsettled weather is forecast from Sunday (20/06/2021) and into Monday (21/06/2021) with similar rainfall totals to today possible due to thunderstorms.  We will continue to monitor the river levels, and will issue further advice if necessary. Our operational staff are keeping the Monks Brook clear of blockages.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  Further rain is possible over the next few days and we will continue to monitor the situation closely. Our staff are checking rivers and flood defence structures and clearing debris. Please continue to monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Standing or surface water may remain in some areas. You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

items.description: River Pang from East Ilsley to Pangbourne and Sulham Brook
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels remain high but are beginning to fall on the River Pang and Sulham Brook following persistent heavy rainfall yesterday 18/06/21. Therefore, the risk of flooding is reducing. 
Some further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours, but totals will be low. River levels are falling, but remain sensitive to further rainfall and therefore still pose a flood risk.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area checking key areas at greatest flood risk.  
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings, and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 20/06/21, or as the situation changes.

Water levels in the Lower River Itchen will continue to fall as we move towards low tide at 12:06 on 19/06/2021, giving the river time to recover. To help lower river levels overnight the sea door at Woodmill has been operated. Flows will remain high due to significant rain in the upper catchment on Friday 18/06/2021 with over a monthâ€™s rainfall (60 mm) recorded at Otterbourne. The weather remains largely dry during the day on Saturday with further unsettled weather forecast from this evening and into Sunday (20/06/2021) and Monday (21/06/2021) with similar rainfall totals to Friday possible due to thunderstorms.

Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no further rainfall during the day today, Saturday 19th June 2021, with light rain overnight tonight and tomorrow, Sunday 20th June 2021. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.message:
This Flood Warning has been removed.  
River levels are now falling, and there is no longer a risk of flooding to property.  
A Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area. Flooding may still affect roads and low lying land.  Further light rainfall is forecast this evening.  
We continue to monitor the situation 
Please continue to monitor local water levels and weather conditions. You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Paston Brook, Werrington Brook, Marholme Brook, Brook Drain and Car Dyke Eye

items.message: The risk of flooding from the Welland Tributaries has now reduced and levels have fallen below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

On Friday we saw heavy rainfall in the Harpers Brook and Willow Brook area. This means that the Harpers Brook and Willow Brook have been rising, which has led to flooding of low lying land and roads close to the brooks on the evening of Friday 18 June. We expect the river to remain high throughout today. We are constantly monitoring river levels, and have staff in the field checking for blockages and clearing weedscreens. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated on 20 June, as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Whitewater and River Hart as a result of heavy rainfall. 
Further rainfall is forecast over the next few hours. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are operating weirs to reduce flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, or as the situation changes.

Water levels in the Eastern Yar continue to fall. Ground will remain wet and responsive due to significant rain in the catchment on Friday 18/06/2021 (40mm falling in 24 hours at Wroxall). The weather remains largely dry during the day on Saturday with further unsettled weather forecast from this evening and into Sunday (20/06/2021) and Monday (21/06/2021) with similar rainfall totals to Friday possible due to thunderstorms.

items.description: Middle River Great Ouse in Milton Keynes, Bedford Borough and Central Bedfordshire
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Newport Pagnell Cemetery river gauge as a result of recent persistent heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible. We expect flooding to affect River Great Ouse from Newport Pagnell to Roxton. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. We expect river levels to remain high and steady. Our incident response staff are monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated this afternoon, Saturday 19 June, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Loddon and River Blackwater at Swallowfield
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are high but steady on the River Loddon and Blackwater as a result of heavy rainfall. 
Further rainfall is forecast over the next few hours. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are operating weirs to reduce flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Loddon as a result of high river levels upstream. 
Further rainfall is forecast through this evening. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are operating weirs to reduce flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, or as the situation changes.
